(CRIME)

cop verb [T]
(RECEIVE/TAKE)
informal to receive or obtain something: She copped an Emmy award last year for her performance. He seems to have copped the blame for the whole mess. They somehow manage to find the money to cop drugs.
UK, informal to take or hold: Cop (hold of) that, would you - I can't carry both myself.
More examplesFewer examplesJulia Roberts copped the best actress Oscar for the role.He copped a three-game suspension for punching another player.I have copped a bit of criticism for the things I've said.
